issues.title: RAR type as container of native_callback_uri
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
- Seems cleaner than structured scope
- Simpler to get WG consent for a RAR type than a new top-level OAuth parameter
- Should native_callback_uri equal the client's redirect_uri? NO - as this validation works ONLY for the 1st AS in the originating trust domain
- Should the structure contain **routing hints?** See separate issue

```
Proposed structure:
{
   "type": "https://scheme.example.org/native_callback_uri",
   "locations": [
      "https://app.example.com/native_callback_uri"
   ]
}
```

issues.title: Consider adding new native_authorization_endpoint and corresponding AS metadata
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
A new endpoint and corresponding authorization server metadata.
Note - AS may reuse existing authorization_endpoint instead of creating separate one, or add a path / query parameter to their existing one.
By providing native_authorization_endpoint, AS commits to:
- Supporting the RAR type
- Forwarding the RAR type
- Redirecting with 30x and not JS / HTTP Form Post
- Does not throw captcha if called without cookies

issues.title: Support routing hints
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
issues.body:
Some AS might need to interact with the user solely for routing inputs (choose your Bank, choose your University, etc).
Such interactions using html:
- Break the browser-less flow.
- Can't share remembered choices made on browser (cookie), with client app

Currently it's declared as an unsupported case.
Alternatively perhaps AS can provide another metadata element: `routing_options_supported` which is an Array of:
`[{hint, description, logo_uri}, {}, {}]`

For example:
```
{
    "hint": "rbro",
    "description": "Raiffeisen Bank Romania",
    "logo_uri": "https://rb.ro/e/e9/Raiffeisen_Bank_Rom%C3%A2nia.svg"
}
```

This enables client to present routing options to end-user, and include in RAR type an array of `hints`.
Cons - Limited. Client can only pull this for first hop

issues.title: Client should detect AS url is claimed on device and if so - not use this protocol
issues.author: yaron-zehavi
